author: Udhav Naig
text:
Actor Dhanush, who was accused by pro-jallikattu activists of ‘betraying a Tamil cause’ on social media, has clarified that he supports jallikattu. A news report which claimed that he supported the apex court ban on the sport had gone viral on social media.

Dhanush’s previous association with People for Ethical Treatment of Animals (PETA) and he being voted the ‘hottest vegetarian’ in a poll conducted by the organisation made the report appear authentic. As accusations turned thick deluge, the actor tweeted dissociating himself from the news report and said that he was a supporter of the event.

Clarifying his association with PETA, Dhanush further said that he was not their brand ambassador as it was being believed. “I was only awarded by them once for being a vegetarian,” he said.

He tweeted: “Happy Maattu Pongal. Also, I never made any comment regarding jallikattu. I support jallikattu. The news that’s going on is a rumour.”

The actor also sought to clarify that he has never associated himself with PETA, which has been campaigning against jallikattu. Dhanush’s clarification comes at a time when actor Amy Jackson is facing protests after supporting the ban. Recently, Veeralakshmi of Tamilar Vidudhalai Padai, protested in front of Nadigar Sangam against Amy Jackson .

Nadigar Sangam president Nasser had already said that he supports jallikattu. Other notable supporters include Kamal Haasan.
title: ‘I support jallikattu,’ clarifies Dhanush
